summary: This is a stipulation filed in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330) in the Southern District of New York. The parties agree that a transcript of a November 6, 2009 deposition taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic and may be admitted as evidence at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case S2 20 CR 330. The stipulation is made on her behalf by her attorneys.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is a party to this stipulation on behalf of the United States.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is the subject of the stipulation.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate to the authenticity of a 2009 deposition transcript for use as evidence in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a stipulation agreeing that a transcript from a November 6, 2009 deposition in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic.
The stipulation is from November 2021, during the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell (case S2 20 CR 330).
The deposition transcript is marked as document 3506-001 and is to be admitted as Government Exhibit 1006 at trial.
The stipulation is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and the defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell.
